intro: Sideritis × candelii var. patxotii, commonly known as the Patxotii sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
